item.title: TonRunner
item.description:
TonRunner

This is my scrapbook of all things that interest, amuse, fascinate and inspire me in the world of swimming, cycling and running. I could have done it on facebook but all my friends and family are probably sick to death of my constant witterings and ramblings.

item.title: 11 Weeks to Brighton
item.description:
11 Weeks to Brighton 

10 & 9 weeks to Brighton

One of the many things I have learned about running and in particular training,  over the last five years is that you can only succeed if you have a goal. If you don't have a goal there is no incentive to train 'hard'. I use the term 'hard' because I actually enjoy running and would more than happily just go for a jog in the countryside, but that is not training. What I mean is having the discipline to go out when the weather is lashing it down, pushing yourself for that last 2miles of a threshold run when it would be so easy to pack it in early, after all who is ever going to know?

item.title: Building Endurance
item.description:
Building Endurance 

In the Bastion you have 2 hrs and 20 minutes to complete the swim leg followed by a further 10 minutes in the first transition to the bike. An average age group swimmer will generally complete the swim in 60-70 minutes.

item.title: parkrun #115
item.description:
parkrun #115

This week we were tail running with Emily and Ollie.

item.title: 2016 Race Schedule
item.description:
2016 Race Schedule

I like competing, I never used to but I have found more and more that I do. It maybe that I have come to accept that I am not really competing against anyone else merely against myself; can I go further faster or higher than I have done before. I think it also comes with the realisation that there is always going to be somebody better than you.

item.title: Is The Gamification Of Fitness A Bad Thing?
item.description:
Is The Gamification Of Fitness A Bad Thing?

We get it: It's not necessarily fun to exercise. Although it's great to have a mindset where you enjoy being active, many people would much rather spend time relaxing on their couch than hitting the gym or going for a run.

item.title: Tonbridge parkrun
item.description:
Tonbridge parkrun

A video produced by Steven Stockwell running the Tonbridge parkrun course as a freedom run in Spring '15

item.title: Find Zen Through Running
item.description:
Find Zen Through Running

Buddhists have a way to tame those animals: meditation. This ancient practice is traditionally done while sitting and focusing on your breathing to achieve peace of mind. But more and more runners are learning how to clear out the commotion while on roads and trails, thanks in part to Sakyong Jamgon Mipham Rinpoche, spiritual leader of a global network of Shambhala Centers (meditation meeting places).

item.title: Standard Distance:1900m swim, 40km Ride, 10km Bike
item.description:
Standard Distance:1900m swim, 40km Ride, 10km Bike

A beautiful but challenging course for my first standard distance triathlon. Posted a 2hr32min time which put me in 64th position out of about 800 so happy with that.
